original: Majjhima Nikāya 95
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Caṅkīsutta
analyzed: caṅkīsutta
translated: With Caṅkī

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena opāsādaṁ nāma kosalānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena opāsādam nāma kosalānam brāhmaṇa gāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: Once, when the Buddha was wandering in the Kosalan country, he arrived at a Kosalan town named Opāsāda.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādaṁ devavane sālavane.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavān opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādam deva vane sāla vane
translated: He stayed in a mango grove to the north of Opāsāda.

original: Tena kho pana samayena caṅkī brāhmaṇo opāsādaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ opāsādam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: At that time, the brahmin Caṅkī was living in Opāsāda. It was a town of the Kosalans, a royal city where King Pasenadi of Kosala had a pleasure park, a verdant park with ponds of water covered with blue, red, and white lotuses, and full of various kinds of waterfowl.

original: Assosuṁ kho opāsādakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: assosum kho opāsādakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmin householders of Opāsāda heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ
translated: “The ascetic Gotama—a son of the Sakyans, gone forth from the Sakyan clan—has arrived at Opāsāda.

original: mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ opāsādaṁ anuppatto, opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādaṁ devavane sālavane.
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim opāsādam an uppattaḥ opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādam deva vane sāla vane
translated: He is staying in a mango grove to the north of Opāsāda.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:🔽‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ  iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: And this good report about Master Gotama has spread:🔽‘Such is he, the Blessed One, accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has himself realized this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, and reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It is good to see such arahants.”

original: Atha kho opāsādakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā opāsādā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā uttarenamukhā gacchanti yena devavanaṁ sālavanaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho opāsādakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ opāsādāḥ nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtāḥ uttarenamukhāḥ gacchanti yena devavanam sāla vana
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Opasāda left Opasāda and went to the Sāla Grove in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā.

original: Tena kho pana samayena caṅkī brāhmaṇo uparipāsāde divāseyyaṁ upagato.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ upari pāsāde divāseyyam upagataḥ
translated: At that time the brahmin Caṅkī had gone up to the verandah to take the sun.

original: Addasā kho caṅkī brāhmaṇo opāsādake brāhmaṇagahapatike opāsādā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūte uttarenamukhaṁ yena devavanaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkamante.
analyzed: addasā kho caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ opāsādake brāhmaṇa gahapatike opāsādā nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūte uttarenamukham yena deva vanam sāla vanam tena upasaṅkamante
translated: He saw the brahmin householders of Opāsāda leaving Opāsāda in the middle of the day, in a body, in a crowd, heading north to the Sāla Grove.

original: Disvā khattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: disvā khattam āmantesi
translated: Seeing this, he addressed his steward:

original: “kiṁ nu kho, bho khatte, opāsādakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā opāsādā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā uttarenamukhā gacchanti yena devavanaṁ sālavanan”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu bho khatte opāsādakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ opāsādāḥ nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtā uttarenamukhāḥ gacchanti yena deva vanam sāla vananti
translated: “Steward, why are the brahmin householders of Opāsāda leaving Opāsāda in a body, in a crowd, heading north to the Sāla Grove?”

original: “Atthi, bho caṅkī, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ🔽caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ opāsādaṁ anuppatto, opāsāde viharati uttarena
analyzed: atthi bho caṅkī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārika  caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim opāsādam an uppattaḥ opāsāde viharati uttarena
translated: “Master Caṅkī, there is a recluse named Gotama, a son of the Sakyans, who went forth from a Sakyan clan.

original: opāsādaṁ devavane sālavane.
analyzed: opāsādam deva vane sāla vane
translated: He is living in Opāsāda, in the Sāla Grove to the north of Opāsāda.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: Now a good report of Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Tamete bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya gacchantī”ti.
analyzed: tam ete bhavantam gotamam dassanāya gacchanti iti
translated: That’s why they are going to see the Lord Buddha.”

original: “Tena hi, bho khatte, yena opāsādakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā opāsādake brāhmaṇagahapatike evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: tena hi bho khatte yena opāsādakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā opāsādake brāhmaṇa gahapatike evam vadehi
translated: “Well then, Khattiya, go to the brahmin householders of Opasada and say to them:

original: ‘caṅkī, bho, brāhmaṇo evamāha—
analyzed: caṅkī bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: ‘The brahmin Canki says this:

original: āgamentu kira bhonto, caṅkīpi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhonto caṅkīpi brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Let the honourable gentlemen come, the brahmin Canki will go to see the recluse Gotama.”’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho so khatto caṅkissa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena opāsādakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā opāsādake brāhmaṇagahapatike etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saḥ khatto caṅkissa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena opāsādakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā opāsādake brāhmaṇa gahapatike etat avoca
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied, and did so.

original: “caṅkī, bho, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
analyzed: caṅkī bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: “The brahmin Canki says this:

original: ‘āgamentu kira bhonto, caṅkīpi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhonto caṅkīpi brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: ‘Please come, sirs, the brahmin Caṅkī will also come to see the ascetic Gotama.’

original: Tena kho pana samayena nānāverajjakānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ pañcamattāni brāhmaṇasatāni opāsāde paṭivasanti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena nānā verajjakānam brāhmaṇānam pañcamattāni brāhmaṇa satāni opāsāde paṭivasanti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: At that time, five hundred brahmins from various states were staying at Opāsāda on some business.

original: Assosuṁ kho te brāhmaṇā:
analyzed: assosum kho te brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: They heard that

original: “caṅkī kira brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: caṅkī kira brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “the brahmin Caṅkī will come to see the ascetic Gotama.”

original: Atha kho te brāhmaṇā yena caṅkī brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā caṅkiṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu te brāhmaṇāḥ yena caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā caṅkim brāhmaṇam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then they went to Caṅkī and said to him:

original: “saccaṁ kira bhavaṁ caṅkī samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhavam caṅkī samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Is it true, Master Caṅkī, that you will come to see the ascetic Gotama?”

original: “Evaṁ kho me, bho, hoti:🔽‘ahaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmī’”ti.🔽“Mā bhavaṁ caṅkī samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkami.
analyzed: evam khalu me bho hoti  aham samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmi iti  mā bhavam caṅkī samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkami
translated: “That is true, sirs.”🔽“But why, Master Caṅkī, do you want to see the ascetic Gotama?🔽Don’t go, Master Caṅkī!

original: Na arahati bhavaṁ caṅkī samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: na arahati bhavam caṅkī samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: It is not proper for you to go to see the ascetic Gotama.

original: samaṇotveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ caṅkiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam caṅkim dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: The ascetic Gotama is the one who should come to see the brahmin Caṅkī,

original: Bhavañhi caṅkī ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.🔽Yampi bhavaṁ caṅkī ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā
analyzed: bhavan hi caṅkī ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena  yam pi bhavam caṅkī ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā
translated: For the brahmin Caṅkī is well-born on both his paternal and maternal sides, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable with respect to birth back to the seventh paternal generation.🔽Since the brahmin Caṅkī is well-born on both his paternal and maternal sides, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable with respect to birth back to the seventh paternal generation,

original: pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ caṅkī🔽samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam caṅkī  samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: for this reason the brahmin Caṅkī does not consider it proper to go to see the ascetic Gotama;

original: samaṇotveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ caṅkiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam caṅkim dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: rather, the ascetic Gotama is the one who should come to see the brahmin Caṅkī.

original: Bhavañhi caṅkī aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi caṅkī mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ pe
translated: For the brahmin Caṅkī is rich, of great wealth and resources …

original: bhavañhi caṅkī tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ, padako, veyyākaraṇo, lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo …pe…
analyzed: bhavañhi caṅkī tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhānam sa akkhara ppabhedānam itihāsa pañcamāna padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ pe
translated: For the brahmin Caṅkī is skilled in the lore of the gods, in the rites and ceremonies of the gods, in the sacrificial formulas of the gods, in the recitation of the sacrificial formulas of the gods, in the recitation of the hymns of the gods, in the three Vedas together with the indexes, ritual, phonology, and etymology, and the testament as fifth; he is thoroughly versed in phenomena, in the meanings, in the expressions, in phonemes, in the elemental principles, and in inner confidence; he is an expert on the past, on the future, and on the present; he is skilled in the signs of the brahmins, in the two-forked ritual, in the water offering, in the sacrificial fire oblation, in the sacrificial fire oblation with husked rice, in the sacrificial fire oblation with husked rice and milk, in the sacrificial fire oblation with husked rice, milk, and ghee, in the sacrificial fire oblation with husked rice, milk, ghee, and meat; he is skilled in the three brahminical activities, in the three Vedas, and in the three supernormal powers; he is skilled in the four noble lineages, in the four forms of full awareness, in the four forms of perfect knowledge, and in the four forms of logical reasoning; he is skilled in the five branches of knowledge, in the five methods of expiation, in the five sacrifices, and in the five inner abysses; he is skilled in the six Vedantic branches, in the six topics of expertise, in the six seasons, in the six directions, in the six forms of supernormal knowledge, and in the six

original: bhavañhi caṅkī abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato brahmavaṇṇī brahmavacchasī akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: bhavañhi caṅkī abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahmavacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: You are handsome, good-looking, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with skin the color of gold, with a forehead like a parasol, a nose like a bream, eyes like a bull, arms like an elephant’s trunk, feet like a deer’s, and calves like an antelope’s.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī sīlavā vuddhasīlī vuddhasīlena samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: bhavañhi caṅkī sīlavā vuddha sīlī vuddha sīlena samannāgato pe
translated: You are virtuous, mature in virtue, possessing mature virtue.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: bhavañhi caṅkī kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: You are a good speaker with a good voice, one who articulates the meaning in a way that is clear.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo, tīṇi māṇavakasatāni mante vāceti …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi caṅkī bahūnam ācariya pācariyaḥ tīṇi māṇavaka satāni mante vācā iti pe
translated: You are the teacher of three hundred students, whom you teach the mantras.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi caṅkī raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: You are honored, respected, revered, venerated, and given homage by King Pasenadi of Kosala.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: bhavañhi caṅkī brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: You are honored, respected, revered, venerated, and given homage by the brahmin Pokkharasati.

original: bhavañhi caṅkī opāsādaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: bhavan hi caṅkī opāsādam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: “Master Caṅkī lives in Opāsāda, a town of the Kosalans, in a royal city named after a nāga, which is prosperous, busy, and full of people, and has much wealth and property, and is populated by a great multitude of people.🔽

original: Yampi bhavaṁ caṅkī opāsādaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ🔽raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ, imināpaṅgena na arahati
analyzed: yam pi bhavam caṅkī opāsādam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhogga  raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnam rāja dāyam brahma deyyai iminā apaṅgena na arahati
translated: You live in Opāsāda, a town with seven gates, with its many advantages, with its many people, crowded with people, a centre of population,🔽given to the Great Ascetic by King Pasenadi of Kosala.

original: bhavaṁ caṅkī samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: bhavam caṅkī samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Because of this, Master Caṅkī does not deserve to come to see the ascetic Gotama;

original: samaṇotveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ caṅkiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitun”ti.
analyzed: gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam caṅkim dassanāya upasaṅkamitunti
translated: the ascetic Gotama deserves to come to see Master Caṅkī.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, caṅkī brāhmaṇo te brāhmaṇe etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ te brāhmaṇe etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Master Caṅkī told those brahmins:

original: “tena hi, bho, mamapi suṇātha, yathā mayameva arahāma taṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: tena hi bho mama api suṇātha yathā mayam eva arahāma tam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: “Then listen, sirs, and pay careful attention as I tell you why I deserve to go to see the ascetic Gotama;

original: na tveva arahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: na tu eva arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: why the ascetic Gotama does not deserve to come to see me.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.🔽Yampi, bho, samaṇo gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena  yam pi bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva
translated: He is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of impeccable birth, and he has been declared success-ful in regard to the claims of the noble birth.

original: sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati so🔽bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati so  bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Since he is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of impeccable birth, and has been declared successful in regard to the claims of the noble birth,🔽on account of this he too does not deserve🔽to come to see the Reverend Gotama;

original: atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo pahūtaṁ hiraññasuvaṇṇaṁ ohāya pabbajito bhūmigatañca vehāsaṭṭhañca …pe…
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ pahūtam hirañña suvaṇṇam ohāya pabbajitaḥ bhūmi gatam ca vehāsaṭṭham ca pe
translated: rather, it is the Reverend Gotama who ought to come to see him.🔽He has gone forth, having abandoned much wealth, both buried treasure and property in the fields.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo daharova samāno yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ daharaḥ uva samānaḥ yuvā susu kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He went forth from the home life into homelessness while still a youth, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though his parents wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam rudantānam kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He went forth from the lay life to homelessness after shaving off his hair and beard, putting on the yellow robe, and going for homelessness.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato brahmavaṇṇī brahmavacchasī akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādikaḥ paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahma vacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: He is handsome, comely, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with sublime skin.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sīlavā ariyasīlī kusalasīlī kusalena sīlena samannāgato …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sīlavā ariya sīlī kusala sīlī kusalena sīlena samannāgato pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: He is virtuous, of increasing virtue, endowed with increasing virtue.🔽He is a good speaker with a good delivery; he speaks words that are courteous, distinct, flawless, and communicate the meaning.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ bahūnam ācariya pācariyaḥ pe
translated: He is a teacher of teachers.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo khīṇakāmarāgo vigatacāpallo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ khīṇa kāma rāgaḥ vigata cāpallaḥ pe
translated: He is free from lust and hate.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kammavādī kiriyavādī apāpapurekkhāro brahmaññāya pajāya …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo uccā kulā pabbajito asambhinnā khattiyakulā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kamma vādī kiriya vādī apāpa purekkhāraḥ brahmaññāya pajāya pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ uccā kulā pabbajitaḥ asambhinnā khattiya kulā pe
translated: He teaches the Dhamma for abandoning misconduct with body, speech, and mind, for abandoning greed, hatred, and delusion.🔽He went forth from an aristocratic family, from an unbroken line of aristocrats.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo aḍḍhā kulā pabbajito mahaddhanā mahābhogā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ aḍḍhā kulā pabbajitaḥ mahat dhanā mahā bhogā pe
translated: He went forth from a wealthy family, from a family of great possessions and property.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā saṁpucchituṁ āgacchanti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā sa pucchitum āgacchanti pe
translated: People come from far away to consult him.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ anekāni devatāsahassāni pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gatāni …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam anekāni devatā sahassāni pāṇehi saraṇam gatāni pe
translated: Many thousands of deities have gone for refuge for life to the Buddha.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:🔽‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ  iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati pe
translated: He has this good reputation:

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ pe
translated: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a blessed one.’🔽He has the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro saputtadāro pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ sa putta dāro pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: King Bimbisāra of Magadha, with his family and his retinue, has gone for refuge for life to the recluse Gotama.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo saputtadāro pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sa putta dāraḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: King Pasenadi of Kosala, with his family and his retinue, has gone for refuge for life to the recluse Gotama.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti saputtadāro pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti sa putta dāraḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: The brahmin Pokkharasāti, with his family and his retinue, has gone for refuge for life to the recluse Gotama.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo opāsādaṁ anuppatto opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādaṁ devavane sālavane.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ opāsādam an uppattaḥ opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādam deva vane sāla vane
translated: The recluse Gotama has arrived at Opasada and is living at Opasada in the Mango Grove of the brahmin Uggatasarīra.

original: Ye kho te samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā amhākaṁ gāmakkhettaṁ āgacchanti, atithī no te honti.
analyzed: ye kho te samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā amhākam gāma kkhettam āgacchanti atithī no te honti
translated: Any recluses or brahmins who come to our village or field are our guests.

original: Atithī kho panamhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā.
analyzed: atithī kho pana amhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā
translated: And a guest should be honoured, respected, revered, and venerated by us.

original: Yampi samaṇo gotamo opāsādaṁ anuppatto opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādaṁ devavane sālavane, atithimhākaṁ samaṇo gotamo.
analyzed: yam pi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ opāsādam an uppattaḥ opāsāde viharati uttarena opāsādam deva vane sāla vane atithimhākam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ
translated: In that the recluse Gotama has come to Opasada and is living at Opasada in the Mango Grove of the brahmin Uggatasarīra, the recluse Gotama is our guest.

original: Atithi kho panamhehi sakkātabbo garukātabbo mānetabbo pūjetabbo.
analyzed: atithi kho pana mhehi sakkātabbaḥ garukātabbaḥ mānetabbaḥ pūjetabbaḥ
translated: A guest should be honoured, respected, revered, and venerated by us.

original: Imināpaṅgena na arahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;🔽atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena na arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On account of this, Master Gotama is not worthy of coming to see me;🔽rather, I am worthy of going to see Master Gotama.

original: Ettake kho ahaṁ, bho, tassa bhoto gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi, no ca kho so bhavaṁ gotamo ettakavaṇṇo;
analyzed: ettake kho aha bho tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi no ca kho saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ettaka vaṇṇaḥ
translated: I have learned only this much praise of Master Gotama, but he is not praised only by this much.

original: aparimāṇavaṇṇo hi so bhavaṁ gotamo.🔽Ekamekenapi tena aṅgena samannāgato na arahati, so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: aparimāṇa vaṇṇaḥ hi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ  ekam ekena api tena aṅgena samannāgataḥ na arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Master Gotama has immeasurable praise.🔽Even if he were to possess only one of these qualities, Master Gotama would not be obliged to come to see me;

original: atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitunti.
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitun ti
translated: rather, I would be obliged to go to see Master Gotama.

original: Tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bho sabbe iva mayam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: So, gentlemen, let us all go to see the recluse Gotama.”

original: Atha kho caṅkī brāhmaṇo mahatā brāhmaṇagaṇena saddhiṁ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.🔽Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ mahatā brāhmaṇa gaṇena saddhim yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi  sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then the brahmin Caṅkī went to the Blessed One, accompanied by a large number of brahmins. He exchanged greetings with the Blessed One, and when this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā vuddhehi vuddhehi brāhmaṇehi saddhiṁ kiñci kiñci kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā nisinno hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bhagavā vuddhehi vuddhehi brāhmaṇehi saddhim kiñci kiñci katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā nisinnaḥ hoti
translated: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was seated finishing some instruction given to a large number of brahmins, who were aged, aged, and venerable.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kāpaṭiko nāma māṇavo daharo vuttasiro soḷasavassuddesiko jātiyā,🔽tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ,
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kāpaṭikaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ daharaḥ vutta siraḥ soḷasa vassuddesikaḥ jātiyā  tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhānam sa akkhara ppabhedānam itihāsa pañcamānam
translated: Then the brahmin student Kaḷārakhattiya, a pupil of the brahmin Caṅkī, was sitting in that assembly.

original: padako, veyyākaraṇo, lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti.
analyzed: padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ tassam parisāyam nisinno hoti
translated: He was young, had gone forth in old age, and was a student of the three Vedas, with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and histories as the fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he was fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man.

original: So vuddhānaṁ vuddhānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ bhagavatā saddhiṁ mantayamānānaṁ antarantarā kathaṁ opāteti.
analyzed: saḥ vuddhānam vuddhānam brāhmaṇānam bhagavatā saddhim mantayamānānam antar antarā katham
translated: While the aged brahmins were conversing with the Blessed One, he kept interrupting their conversation.

original: Atha kho bhagavā kāpaṭikaṁ māṇavaṁ apasādeti:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā kāpaṭikam māṇavam apasādeti
translated: The Buddha then tried to dissuade him, saying,

original: “māyasmā bhāradvājo vuddhānaṁ vuddhānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ mantayamānānaṁ antarantarā kathaṁ opātetu.
analyzed: mā ayasmai bhāradvājaḥ vuddhānam vuddhānam brāhmaṇānam mantayamānānam antar antarā katham
translated: “Don’t interrupt the discussion of the brahmin elders.

original: Kathāpariyosānaṁ āyasmā bhāradvājo āgametū”ti.
analyzed: kathā pariyosānam āyasmai bhāradvājaḥ āgametu uti
translated: Wait until it’s finished.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, caṅkī brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte caṅkī brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When he said this, Caṅkī said to the Buddha,

original: “mā bhavaṁ gotamo kāpaṭikaṁ māṇavaṁ apasādesi.
analyzed: mā bhavam gotamaḥ kāpaṭikam māṇavam apasādesi
translated: “Don’t try to dissuade Kāpaṭika.

original: kulaputto ca kāpaṭiko māṇavo, bahussuto ca kāpaṭiko māṇavo, paṇḍito ca kāpaṭiko māṇavo,🔽kalyāṇavākkaraṇo ca kāpaṭiko māṇavo, pahoti ca kāpaṭiko māṇavo bhotā gotamena saddhiṁ
analyzed: kula putto ca kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ bahu ssuto ca kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ paṇḍitaḥ ca kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ  kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ ca kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ ca kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ bhotā gotamena saddhi
translated: He’s a gentleman, he’s learned, he’s wise,

original: asmiṁ vacane paṭimantetun”ti.
analyzed: asmin vacane
translated: he’s eloquent, and he’s capable of discussing this matter with you.”

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “addhā kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa tevijjake pāvacane kathā bhavissati.
analyzed: addhā kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa tevijjake pāvacane kathā bhavissati
translated: “Kāpaṭika will certainly discuss the three knowledges.

original: Tathā hi naṁ brāhmaṇā sampurekkharontī”ti.
analyzed: tathā hi nam brāhmaṇāḥ sampurekkharonti iti
translated: That’s why the brahmins are so keen on him.”

original: Atha kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa etat ahosi
translated: Kāpaṭika thought,

original: “yadā me samaṇo gotamo cakkhuṁ upasaṁharissati, athāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pañhaṁ pucchissāmī”ti.
analyzed: yadā me samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ cakkhum upasaharissati atha aham samaṇam gotamam pañham pucchissāmi iti
translated: “When the ascetic Gotama looks at me, I’ll ask him a question.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya yena kāpaṭiko māṇavo tena cakkhūni upasaṁhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa cetasā cetaḥ pari vitakka maññāya yena kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ tena cakkhūni upasahāsi
translated: Then the Buddha, knowing what Kāpaṭika was thinking, looked at him.

original: Atha kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho kāpaṭikassa māṇavassa etat ahosi
translated: Kāpaṭika thought,

original: “samannāharati kho maṁ samaṇo gotamo.
analyzed: samannāharati khalu mama samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ
translated: “The ascetic Gotama is looking at me.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham samaṇam gotamam pañham puccheyyanti
translated: Why don’t I ask him a question?”

original: Atha kho kāpaṭiko māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu kāpaṭikaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then said to the Buddha,

original: “yadidaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṁ porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ itihitihaparamparāya piṭakasampadāya, tattha ca brāhmaṇā ekaṁsena niṭṭhaṁ gacchanti:
analyzed: yat idam bho gotama brāhmaṇānam porāṇam manta padam iti hiti ha paramparāya piṭaka sampadāya tattha ca brāhmaṇāḥ eka sena niṭṭham gacchanti
translated: “Sir, Gotama, there are these ancient brahmin hymns about the ancient brahmin seers, the creators, the makers, the generators, the manifestors, the lords, the offspring of Brahmā, born from his mouth, born from his mind, born from Brahmā, created by Brahmā, heirs of Brahmā.🔽The brahmins, following this ancient line of teachers, declare:

original: ‘idameva saccaṁ, moghamaññan’ti.
analyzed: idam eva sat ca mogham aññanti
translated: ‘Only this is the truth, anything else is wrong.’

original: Idha bhavaṁ gotamo kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ kim āha ati
translated: What do you say about this?”

original: “Kiṁ pana, bhāradvāja, atthi koci brāhmaṇānaṁ ekabrāhmaṇopi yo evamāha:
analyzed: kim pana bhāradvāja atthi koci brāhmaṇānam eka brāhmaṇaḥ api yaḥ evam āha
translated: “But, Bhāradvāja, is there a single brahmin who says:

original: ‘ahametaṁ jānāmi, ahametaṁ passāmi.
analyzed: aham etam jānāmi aham etam passāmi
translated: ‘I know this, I see this.

original: Idameva saccaṁ, moghamaññan’”ti?
analyzed: idam eva sat ca mogham aññanti
translated: That’s true, and anything else is just delusion’?”

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: na u hida bho gotama

original: Seyyathāpi, bhāradvāja, andhaveṇi paramparāsaṁsattā purimopi na passati majjhimopi na passati pacchimopi na passati;

original: evameva kho, bhāradvāja, andhaveṇūpamaṁ maññe brāhmaṇānaṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjati—purimopi na passati majjhimopi na passati pacchimopi na passati.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhāradvāja andha veṇu upamam maññe brāhmaṇānam bhāsitam sampajjati purimaḥ api na passati majjhimaḥ api na passati pacchimaḥ api na passati
translated: in the same way, Bhāradvāja, it seems to me that the brahmins’ statement turns out like a line of blind men—the first one does not see, the middle one does not see, and the last one does not see.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, bhāradvāja,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi bhāradvāja
translated: What do you think, Bhāradvāja?

original: nanu evaṁ sante brāhmaṇānaṁ amūlikā saddhā sampajjatī”ti?
analyzed: nanu evam sante brāhmaṇānam amūlikā saddhā sampajjati iti
translated: When this is the case, doesn’t the brahmins’ faith turn out to be groundless?”

original: “Na khvettha, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā saddhāyeva payirupāsanti, anussavāpettha brāhmaṇā payirupāsantī”ti.
analyzed: na khu ettha bho gotama brāhmaṇā saddhāya iva payirupāsanti anussavā apa ittha brāhmaṇā payirupāsanti iti
translated: “In this case, Master Gotama, the brahmins don’t serve the gods out of faith alone, but out of tradition as well.”

original: “Pubbeva kho tvaṁ, bhāradvāja, saddhaṁ agamāsi, anussavaṁ idāni vadesi.

translated: “First you went by faith, now you speak of tradition.

original: Pañca kho ime, bhāradvāja, dhammā diṭṭheva dhamme dvedhā vipākā.
analyzed: pañca kho ime bhāradvāja dhammā diṭṭhā iva dhamme dvedhā vipākā
translated: Bhāradvāja, there are these five things that have results visible in the here and now.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What five?

original: Saddhā, ruci, anussavo, ākāraparivitakko, diṭṭhinijjhānakkhanti—
analyzed: saddhā ruci anussavaḥ ākāra parivitakkaḥ diṭṭhi nijjhāna kkhanti
translated: Faith, approval, oral tradition, reasoned cogitation, and reflective acceptance of a view.

original: ime kho, bhāradvāja, pañca dhammā diṭṭheva dhamme dvedhā vipākā.
analyzed: ime kho bhāradvāja pañca dhammā diṭṭhā iva dhamme dvedhā vipākā
translated: These five things, Bharadvaja, have results here and now.

original: Api ca, bhāradvāja, susaddahitaṁyeva hoti, tañca hoti rittaṁ tucchaṁ musā;
analyzed: api ca bhāradvāja su sadda hitayā iva hoti tat ca hoti rittam tuccham musā

original: no cepi susaddahitaṁ hoti, tañca hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ anaññathā.
analyzed: no ce ipi su saddahitam hoti tat ca hoti bhūtam taccham an aññathā
translated: or it may be that what is not well believed is factual, true, and not otherwise.

original: Api ca, bhāradvāja, surucitaṁyeva hoti …pe…🔽svānussutaṁyeva hoti …pe…
analyzed: api ca bhāradvāja surucitayā iva hoti pe  sva anussutayā iva hoti pe
translated: “But, Bharadvaja, it may be that what is well approved is…🔽that what is well heard is…

original: suparivitakkitaṁyeva hoti …pe…
analyzed: su parivitakkitayā iva hoti pe
translated: that what is well pondered is…

original: sunijjhāyitaṁyeva hoti, tañca hoti rittaṁ tucchaṁ musā;
analyzed: su nijjhāyi tayā iva hoti tat ca hoti rittam tuccham musā
translated: that what is well penetrated is empty, hollow, and false;

original: no cepi sunijjhāyitaṁ hoti, tañca hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ anaññathā.
analyzed: no ce ipi su nijjhāyitam hoti tat ca hoti bhūtam taccham an aññathā
translated: or it may be that what is not well penetrated is factual, true, and not otherwise.

original: Saccamanurakkhatā, bhāradvāja, viññunā purisena nālamettha ekaṁsena niṭṭhaṁ gantuṁ:
analyzed: saccam anurakkhatā bhāradvāja viññunā purisena na alam ettha ekasena niṭṭham gantu
translated: “A wise man, Bharadvaja, who preserves truth should not come to a definite conclusion:

original: ‘idameva saccaṁ, moghamaññan’”ti.
analyzed: idam eva sat ca mogham aññanti
translated: ‘Only this is true, anything otherwise is worthless.’“

original: “Kittāvatā pana, bho gotama, saccānurakkhaṇā hoti, kittāvatā saccamanurakkhati?
analyzed: kittāvatā pana bho gotama sacca anurakkhaṇā hoti kittāvatā saccam anurakkhati
translated: “But, Master Gotama, how far does the preservation of truth go? To what extent does one preserve truth?”

original: Saccānurakkhaṇaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: sacca anurakkhaṇam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the Lord Gotama about the preservation of truth.”

original: “Saddhā cepi, bhāradvāja, purisassa hoti;
analyzed: saddhā cepi bhāradvāja purisassa hoti
translated: “If a man has faith,

original: ‘evaṁ me saddhā’ti—
analyzed: evam me saddhāti
translated: saying ‘I have faith,’

original: iti vadaṁ saccamanurakkhati, na tveva tāva ekaṁsena niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: iti vadam saccam anurakkhati na tu eva tāva eka sena niṭṭham gacchati
translated: he preserves truth, but he has not yet come to the definite conclusion:

original: ‘idameva saccaṁ, moghamaññan’ti (…).
analyzed: idam eva sat ca mogham aññanti
translated: ‘This alone is the truth, other ideas are silly.’

original: Ruci cepi, bhāradvāja, purisassa hoti …pe…🔽anussavo cepi, bhāradvāja, purisassa hoti …pe…🔽ākāraparivitakko cepi, bhāradvāja, purisassa hoti …pe…
analyzed: ruci cepi bhāradvāja purisassa hoti pe  anussavaḥ ce pi bhāradvāja purisassa hoti pe  ākāra parivitakko ce pi bhāradvāja purisassa hoti pe
translated: If a man has a liking,🔽If a man has a tradition,🔽If a man has a reasoned cogitation,

original: diṭṭhinijjhānakkhanti cepi, bhāradvāja, purisassa hoti;
analyzed: diṭṭhi nijjhāna kkhanti ce pi bhāradvāja purisassa hoti
translated: If a man has a reasoned attention to views,

original: ‘evaṁ me diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantī’ti—
analyzed: evam me diṭṭhi nijjhāna kkhanti iti
translated: saying ‘I have reasoned attention to views,’

original: iti vadaṁ saccamanurakkhati, na tveva tāva ekaṁsena niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: iti vadam saccam anurakkhati na tu eva tāva eka sena niṭṭham gacchati
translated: he preserves truth, but he has not yet come to the definite conclusion:

original: ‘idameva saccaṁ, moghamaññan’ti.
analyzed: idam eva sat ca mogham aññanti
translated: ‘This alone is the truth, other ideas are silly.’

original: Ettāvatā kho, bhāradvāja, saccānurakkhaṇā hoti, ettāvatā saccamanurakkhati, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānurakkhaṇaṁ paññapema;
analyzed: ettāvatā kho bhāradvāja sacca anurakkhaṇā hoti ettāvatā saccam anurakkhati ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anurakkhaṇam paññapema
translated: “To this extent, Bharadvaja, there is the preservation of truth, to this extent there is what is meant by the preservation of truth, and to this extent the exposition of the preservation of truth is to be understood.

original: na tveva tāva saccānubodho hotī”ti.
analyzed: na tu eva tāva sat ca anubodhaḥ
translated: But that is not yet the realization of truth.”

original: “Ettāvatā, bho gotama, saccānurakkhaṇā hoti, ettāvatā saccamanurakkhati, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānurakkhaṇaṁ pekkhāma.
analyzed: ettāvatā bho gotama sacca anurakkhaṇā hoti ettāvatā saccam anurakkhati ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anurakkhaṇam pekkhāma
translated: “That is how we understand the guarding of the truth, in the way we have been taught by the great recluse.

original: Kittāvatā pana, bho gotama, saccānubodho hoti, kittāvatā saccamanubujjhati?
analyzed: kittāvatā pana bho gotama sacca anubodhaḥ hoti kittāvatā saccam anubujjhati
translated: But how is there the realization of truth?

original: Saccānubodhaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca anubodham mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the great recluse about the realization of truth.”

original: “Idha, bhāradvāja, bhikkhu aññataraṁ gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā upanissāya viharati.
analyzed: idha bhāradvāja bhikkhu aññataram gāmam vā nigamam vā upanissāya viharati
translated: “Here, Bharadvaja, a bhikkhu lives in dependence upon a certain village or town.

original: Tamenaṁ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upasaṅkamitvā tīsu dhammesu samannesati—
analyzed: tam enam gahapati vā gahapati putto vā upasaṅkamitvā tīsu dhammesu samannesati
translated: Then a householder or a householder’s son visits him and examines him in regard to three things:

original: lobhanīyesu dhammesu, dosanīyesu dhammesu, mohanīyesu dhammesu.
analyzed: lobhanīyesu dhammesu dosanīyesu dhammesu mohanīyesu dhammesu
translated: things that inspire lust, things that inspire hatred, and things that inspire delusion.

original: Atthi nu kho imassāyasmato tathārūpā lobhanīyā dhammā yathārūpehi lobhanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinnacitto ajānaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: atthi nu kho imassa āyasmataḥ tathārūpāḥ lobhanīyāḥ dhammāḥ yathārūpehi lobhanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinna cittaḥ a jānam vā vadeyya
translated: “Does this venerable one speak in praise of lustful thoughts, of hatred and delusion?

original: jānāmīti, apassaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: jānāmi iti apassam vā vadeyya
translated: Does he, having done and accumulated what is unwholesome, speak in praise of it?

original: passāmīti, paraṁ vā tadatthāya samādapeyya yaṁ paresaṁ assa dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāyāti?
analyzed: passāmi iti param vā tad atthāya samādapeyya yam paresam assa dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati
translated: ‘I see that such things exist in him, or I would advise him to do what would be for his long-term harm and suffering.’

original: Tamenaṁ samannesamāno evaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: tam enam samannesamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: When he investigates him, he comes to know:

original: ‘natthi kho imassāyasmato tathārūpā lobhanīyā dhammā yathārūpehi lobhanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinnacitto ajānaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: natthi kho imassa āyasmataḥ tathārūpāḥ lobhanīyāḥ dhammāḥ yathārūpehi lobhanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinna cittaḥ a jānam vā vadeyya
translated: ‘There are no such things in this venerable one that he, with a mind obsessed by greed, would say:

original: jānāmīti, apassaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: jānāmi iti apassam vā vadeyya
translated: “I know,” when he doesn’t know, or “I see,” when he doesn’t see;

original: passāmīti, paraṁ vā tadatthāya samādapeyya yaṁ paresaṁ assa dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya.
analyzed: passāmi iti param vā tad atthāya samādapeyya yam paresam assa dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya
translated: or that he would advise someone to do what would be for his long-term harm and suffering.

original: Tathārūpo kho panimassāyasmato kāyasamācāro tathārūpo vacīsamācāro yathā taṁ aluddhassa.
analyzed: tathārūpaḥ kho panimassa āyasmataḥ kāya samācāro tathārūpaḥ vacī samācāraḥ yathā tam a luddhassa
translated: And this venerable one’s bodily and verbal behavior show him to be free of greed.

original: Yaṁ kho pana ayamāyasmā dhammaṁ deseti, gambhīro so dhammo duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo;
analyzed: yam kho pana ayam āyasmai dhammam deseti gambhīraḥ saḥ dhammaḥ duddasaḥ duranubodhaḥ santo paṇītaḥ a takka avacaraḥ nipuṇaḥ paṇḍita vedanīyo
translated: And the Dhamma that this venerable one teaches is profound, hard to see and hard to understand, peaceful and sublime, unattainable by mere reasoning, subtle, to be experienced by the wise.

original: na so dhammo sudesiyo luddhenā’ti.
analyzed: na so dhammaḥ su desiyaḥ luddhena ati
translated: This Dhamma can’t easily be taught by one who is greedy.’

original: Yato naṁ samannesamāno visuddhaṁ lobhanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati tato naṁ uttari samannesati dosanīyesu dhammesu.
analyzed: yatas nam samannesamānaḥ visuddham lobhanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati tatas nam uttari samannesati dosanīyesu dhammesu
translated: When he investigates him and sees that he is pure with regard to things that cause greed, he then investigates him with regard to things that cause hate.

original: Atthi nu kho imassāyasmato tathārūpā dosanīyā dhammā yathārūpehi dosanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinnacitto ajānaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: atthi nu kho imassa āyasmataḥ tathārūpāḥ dosanīyāḥ dhammāḥ yathārūpehi dosanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinna cittaḥ a jānam vā vadeyya
translated: Are there any things that cause hate in this person because of which, his mind overwhelmed by those things that cause hate, he might, in regard to things that cause hate, say what is not fact is fact and what is fact is not fact,

analyzed: jānāmi iti apassam vā vadeyya  passāmi iti param vā tad atthāya samādapeyya yam paresam assa dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati
translated: or say what is not seen is seen and what is seen is not seen,🔽or advise another for the sake of his long-term harm, suffering, and pain?

original: Tamenaṁ samannesamāno evaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: tam enam samannesamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: When he investigates him and sees that he is pure with regard to things that cause hate, he then investigates him with regard to things that cause delusion.

translated: Are there any things that cause delusion in this person because of which, his mind overwhelmed by those things that cause delusion, he might, in regard to things that cause delusion, say what is not fact is fact and what is fact is not fact,

original: jānāmīti, apassaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: jānāmi iti apassam vā vadeyya
translated: or say what is not seen is seen and what is seen is not seen,

original: passāmīti, paraṁ vā tadatthāya samādapeyya yaṁ paresaṁ assa dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya.

translated: or advise another for the sake of his long-term harm, suffering, and pain?

analyzed: tathārūpaḥ kho panimassa āyasmataḥ kāya samācāro tathārūpaḥ vacī samācāraḥ yathā tam aduṭṭhassa
translated: His bodily and verbal behavior are such as to show that he is free of hate.

original: Yaṁ kho pana ayamāyasmā dhammaṁ deseti, gambhīro so dhammo duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo;

translated: And the Dhamma he teaches is profound, hard to see and hard to understand, peaceful and sublime, unattainable by mere reasoning, subtle, to be experienced by the wise.

original: na so dhammo sudesiyo duṭṭhenā’ti.🔽Yato naṁ samannesamāno visuddhaṁ dosanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati, tato naṁ uttari samannesati mohanīyesu dhammesu.
analyzed: na so dhammo su desiyaḥ duṭṭhena ati  yatas nam samannesamānaḥ visuddham dosanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati tatas nam uttari samannesati mohanīyesu dhammesu
translated: It’s not easy for one of impure habits and conduct to teach such a Dhamma.🔽When he investigates him and sees that he is pure in the things that are grounds for accusations, he then investigates him in regard to the things that are grounds for suspicion of lust.

original: Atthi nu kho imassāyasmato tathārūpā mohanīyā dhammā yathārūpehi mohanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinnacitto ajānaṁ vā vadeyya—🔽jānāmīti, apassaṁ vā vadeyya—
analyzed: atthi nu kho imassa āyasmataḥ tathārūpāḥ mohanīyāḥ dhammāḥ yathārūpehi mohanīyehi dhammehi pariyādinna cittaḥ a jānam vā vadeyya  jānāmi iti apassam vā vadeyya
translated: Are there any things that are grounds for suspicion of lust in this person such that, with his mind obsessed by them, he might knowingly speak falsehood?🔽Or might he claim to have seen what he has not seen, heard what he has not heard, thought what he has not thought, or known what he has not known?

original: passāmīti, paraṁ vā tadatthāya samādapeyya yaṁ paresaṁ assa dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāyāti?
analyzed: passāmi iti param vā tad atthāya samādapeyya yam paresam assa dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati

original: Tamenaṁ samannesamāno evaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: tam enam samannesamānaḥ evam jānāti
translated: When he investigates him and sees that he is pure in the things that are grounds for suspicion of lust,

translated: ‘There are no such things that cause confusion in this venerable one, because of which, with his mind obsessed by them, he might say:

translated: “I know, I see—

original: passāmīti, paraṁ vā tadatthāya samādapeyya yaṁ paresaṁ assa dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya.
analyzed: passāmi iti param vā tad atthāya samādapeyya yam paresam assa dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya
translated: I will instruct you further in this matter.”

original: Tathārūpo kho panimassāyasmato kāyasamācāro tathārūpo vacīsamācāro yathā taṁ amūḷhassa.
analyzed: tathārūpaḥ kho panimassa āyasmataḥ kāya samācāro tathārūpaḥ vacī samācāraḥ yathā tam amūḍhassa
translated: And this venerable one’s bodily and verbal behaviour show him to be free of confusion.

original: Yaṁ kho pana ayamāyasmā dhammaṁ deseti, gambhīro so dhammo duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo;
analyzed: yam kho pana ayam āyasmai dhammam deseti gambhīraḥ saḥ dhammaḥ duddasaḥ duranubodhaḥ santo paṇītaḥ a takka avacaraḥ nipuṇaḥ paṇḍita vedanīyo
translated: And the Dhamma that this venerable one teaches is profound, hard to see and hard to understand, peaceful and sublime, unattainable by mere reasoning, subtle, to be experienced by the wise.

original: na so dhammo sudesiyo mūḷhenā’ti.
analyzed: na so dhammo su desiyaḥ mūḷhena ati
translated: This Dhamma cannot easily be taught by one affected by greed.’

original: Yato naṁ samannesamāno visuddhaṁ mohanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati;
analyzed: yatas nam samannesamānaḥ visuddham mohanīyehi dhammehi samanupassati
translated: When he investigates him and sees that he is pure with regard to the things that cause confusion,

original: atha tamhi saddhaṁ niveseti, saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati,
analyzed: atha tamhi saddham niveseti saddhā jātaḥ upasaṅkamati upasaṅkamantaḥ payis upāsati
translated: he places confidence in him, and his confidence in the Buddha is strengthened. He approaches him, listens to the Dhamma, understands it, and then approaches other bhikkhus in order to tell them.

original: payirupāsanto sotaṁ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṁ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṁ dhāreti, dhatānaṁ
analyzed: payis upāsantaḥ sotam odahati ohita sotaḥ dhammam suṇāti sutvā dhammam dhāreti dhatāna
translated: while worshipping, he sharpens his ear, with his ear sharpened he listens to the Dhamma, having listened to the Dhamma he remembers it, having remembered it he

original: dhammānaṁ atthaṁ upaparikkhati, atthaṁ upaparikkhato dhammā nijjhānaṁ khamanti, dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā🔽sati chando jāyati, chandajāto ussahati, ussahitvā tuleti, tulayitvā padahati, pahitatto🔽samāno kāyena ceva paramasaccaṁ sacchikaroti paññāya ca naṁ ativijjha passati.
analyzed: dhammānam attham upaparikkhati attham upaparikkhataḥ dhammāḥ nijjhānam khamanti dhamma nijjhāna kkhantiyā  sati chandaḥ jāyati chanda jātaḥ ussahati ussahitvā tuleti tulayitvā padahati pahitattaḥ  samānaḥ kāyena ca iva paramasaccam sacchikaroti paññāya ca nam ativijjha passati
translated: When he has done this, he becomes keen to listen. Keen to listen, he hears the Dhamma. Having heard the Dhamma, he memorises it.🔽Having memorised it, he examines the meaning of those teachings. As he examines their meaning, the teachings become clear to him.

original: Ettāvatā kho, bhāradvāja, saccānubodho hoti, ettāvatā saccamanubujjhati, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānubodhaṁ paññapema;🔽na tveva tāva saccānuppatti hotī”ti.🔽“Ettāvatā, bho gotama, saccānubodho hoti, ettāvatā saccamanubujjhati, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānubodhaṁ pekkhāma.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho bhāradvāja sacca anubodhaḥ hoti ettāvatā saccam anubujjhati ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anubodham paññapema 🔽na tu eva tāva sacca anuppatti hoti iti 🔽ettāvatā bho gotama sacca anubodhaḥ hoti ettāvatā saccam anubujjhati ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anubodham pekkhāma
translated: When the teachings are clear to him, he becomes eager. Being eager, he endeavours. Endeavouring, he burns with energy. Burning with energy, he attains the abandonment of the mental effluents.

original: Kittāvatā pana, bho gotama, saccānuppatti hoti, kittāvatā saccamanupāpuṇāti?
analyzed: kittāvatā pana bho gotama sacca anuppatti hoti kittāvatā saccam anupāpuṇāti
translated: “But in what way, Master Gotama, does one attain truth? In what way does one attain the true way?

original: Saccānuppattiṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: sacca anuppattim mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma iti
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the attainment of truth.”

original: “Tesaṁyeva, bhāradvāja, dhammānaṁ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṁ saccānuppatti hoti.
analyzed: tesayā iva bhāradvāja dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammam sacca anuppatti hoti
translated: “By cultivating and making much of those same things, Bhāradvāja, one attains truth.

original: Ettāvatā kho, bhāradvāja, saccānuppatti hoti, ettāvatā saccamanupāpuṇāti, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānuppattiṁ paññapemā”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho bhāradvāja sacca anuppatti hoti ettāvatā saccam anupāpuṇāti ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anuppattim paññapema ati
translated: In this way, Bhāradvāja, one attains truth; in this way one attains the true way; and in this way we describe the attainment of truth.”

original: “Ettāvatā, bho gotama, saccānuppatti hoti, ettāvatā saccamanupāpuṇāti, ettāvatā ca mayaṁ saccānuppattiṁ pekkhāma.
analyzed: ettāvatā bho gotama sacca anuppatti hoti ettāvatā saccam anupāpuṇāti ettāvatā ca mayam sacca anuppattim pekkhāma
translated: “In this way, Master Gotama, one attains truth; in this way one attains the true way; and in this way we understand the attainment of truth as described by Master Gotama.

original: Saccānuppattiyā pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: sacca anuppattiyāḥ pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāraḥ
translated: But, Master Gotama, what is the most helpful thing for the attainment of truth?

original: Saccānuppattiyā bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: sacca anuppattiyāḥ bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the most helpful thing for the attainment of truth.”

original: “Saccānuppattiyā kho, bhāradvāja, padhānaṁ bahukāraṁ.
analyzed: sacca anuppattiyā kho bhāradvāja padhānam bahu kāra
translated: “Exertion is the most helpful thing for the attainment of truth, Bhāradvāja.

original: No cetaṁ padaheyya, nayidaṁ saccamanupāpuṇeyya.
analyzed: no ca itam padaheyya na idam saccam anupāpuṇeyya
translated: If one did not exert oneself, one would not attain truth.

original: Yasmā ca kho padahati tasmā saccamanupāpuṇāti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho padahati tasmai saccam anupāpuṇāti
translated: But because he perseveres, he attains the truth.

original: Tasmā saccānuppattiyā padhānaṁ bahukāran”ti.
analyzed: tasmā sacca anuppattiyā padhānam
translated: So perseverance is the many-factored cause for attaining the truth.”

original: “Padhānassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: padhānassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the many-factored state for perseverance?

original: Padhānassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: padhānassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the many-factored state for perseverance.”

original: “Padhānassa kho, bhāradvāja, tulanā bahukārā.
analyzed: padhānassa kho bhāradvāja tulanā bahu kārā
translated: “Weighing is the many-factored state for perseverance.

original: No cetaṁ tuleyya, nayidaṁ padaheyya.
analyzed: na u ca itam tuleyya nayidam padaheyya
translated: If one did not weigh, one would not persevere.

original: Yasmā ca kho tuleti tasmā padahati.
analyzed: ca tulā iti tasmai padahati
translated: But because one weighs, one perseveres.

original: Tasmā padhānassa tulanā bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmā padhānassa tulanā bahu kārā ati
translated: So weighing is the many-factored state for perseverance.”

original: “Tulanāya pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: tulanāya pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammo bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the many-factored state for weighing?

original: Tulanāya bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: tulanāya bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the many-factored state for weighing.”

original: “Tulanāya kho, bhāradvāja, ussāho bahukāro.🔽No cetaṁ ussaheyya, nayidaṁ tuleyya.
analyzed: tulanāya kho bhāradvājaḥ ussāhaḥ bahu kāraḥ  no ca itam ussaheyya nayidam tuleyya
translated: “Exertion is the many-factored state for weighing.🔽If one did not exert oneself, one would not weigh.

original: Yasmā ca kho ussahati tasmā tuleti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho ussahati tasmai tuleti
translated: But because one exerts oneself, one weighs.

original: Tasmā tulanāya ussāho bahukāro”ti.
analyzed: tasmai tulanāya ussāhaḥ
translated: So exertion is the many-factored state for weighing.”

original: “Ussāhassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: ussāhassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāraḥ
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the many-factored state for exertion?

original: Ussāhassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: ussāhassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the Lord Gotama about the thing that is helpful for persistence.”

original: “Ussāhassa kho, bhāradvāja, chando bahukāro.🔽No cetaṁ chando jāyetha, nayidaṁ ussaheyya.
analyzed: ussāhassa kho bhāradvāja chandaḥ bahu kāraḥ  na u ca itam chandaḥ jāyetha na idam ussaheyya
translated: “Desire, Bharadvaja, is helpful for persistence.🔽If desire did not arise, there would be no persistence.

original: Yasmā ca kho chando jāyati tasmā ussahati.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho chandaḥ jāyati tasmai ussahati
translated: But because desire arises, there is persistence.

original: Tasmā ussāhassa chando bahukāro”ti.
analyzed: tasmai ussāhassa chandaḥ
translated: That is why desire is helpful for persistence.”

original: “Chandassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: chandassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Reverend Gotama, what is helpful for desire?

original: Chandassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: chandassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the Lord Gotama about the thing that is helpful for desire.”

original: “Chandassa kho, bhāradvāja, dhammanijjhānakkhanti bahukārā.🔽No cete dhammā nijjhānaṁ khameyyuṁ, nayidaṁ chando jāyetha.

translated: “Acceptance of Dhamma, Bharadvaja, is helpful for desire.🔽If one did not accept Dhamma, desire would not arise.

original: Yasmā ca kho dhammā nijjhānaṁ khamanti tasmā chando jāyati.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho dhammā nijjhānam khamanti tasmai chandaḥ jāyati
translated: But because one accepts Dhamma, desire arises.

original: Tasmā chandassa dhammanijjhānakkhanti bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmā chandassa dhamma nijjhāna kkhanti bahu kārā ati
translated: That is why acceptance of Dhamma is helpful for desire.”

original: “Dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: dhamma nijjhāna khantiyā pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Reverend Gotama, what is helpful for acceptance of Dhamma?

original: Dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: dhamma nijjhāna kkhantiyā bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the Lord Gotama about the great benefit of the acceptance of the Dhamma after pondering it.”

original: “Dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā kho, bhāradvāja, atthūpaparikkhā bahukārā.🔽No cetaṁ atthaṁ upaparikkheyya, nayidaṁ dhammā nijjhānaṁ khameyyuṁ.
analyzed: dhamma nijjhāna khantiyā kho bhāradvāja attha upaparikkhā bahu kārā  no ca itam attham upaparikkheyya na idam dhammāḥ nijjhānam khameyyu
translated: “Bhāradvāja, the investigation of the meaning is of great benefit for the acceptance of the Dhamma after pondering it.🔽If one did not investigate the meaning, one would not accept the Dhamma after pondering it.

original: Yasmā ca kho atthaṁ upaparikkhati tasmā dhammā nijjhānaṁ khamanti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho attham upaparikkhati tasmā dhammāḥ nijjhānam khamanti
translated: But because one investigates the meaning, one accepts the Dhamma after pondering it.

original: Tasmā dhammanijjhānakkhantiyā atthūpaparikkhā bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmā dhamma nijjhāna kkhantiyāḥ attha upaparikkhā bahu kārā ati
translated: Therefore, the investigation of the meaning is of great benefit for the acceptance of the Dhamma after pondering it.”

original: “Atthūpaparikkhāya pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: attha upaparikkhāya pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is of great benefit for the investigation of the meaning?

original: Atthūpaparikkhāya bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: atthu upaparikkhāya bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask the Lord Gotama about the great benefit of the investigation of the meaning.”

original: “Atthūpaparikkhāya kho, bhāradvāja, dhammadhāraṇā bahukārā.🔽No cetaṁ dhammaṁ dhāreyya, nayidaṁ atthaṁ upaparikkheyya.
analyzed: atthu upaparikkhāya kho bhāradvāja dhamma dhāraṇā bahu kārā  no ca itam dhammam dhāreyya na idam attham upaparikkheyya
translated: “Bhāradvāja, the retention of the Dhamma is of great benefit for the investigation of the meaning.🔽If one did not retain the Dhamma, one would not investigate the meaning.

original: Yasmā ca kho dhammaṁ dhāreti tasmā atthaṁ upaparikkhati.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho dhammam dhāreti tasmai attham upaparikkhati
translated: But because one retains the Dhamma, one investigates the meaning.

original: Tasmā atthūpaparikkhāya dhammadhāraṇā bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmai attha upaparikkhāya dhamma dhāraṇā bahu kārā ati
translated: Therefore, the retention of the Dhamma is very helpful for the investigation of the meaning.”

original: “Dhammadhāraṇāya pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: dhamma dhāraṇāya pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is very helpful for the retention of the Dhamma?

original: Dhammadhāraṇāya bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: dhamma dhāraṇāya bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the thing that is very helpful for the retention of the Dhamma.”

original: “Dhammadhāraṇāya kho, bhāradvāja, dhammassavanaṁ bahukāraṁ.
analyzed: dhamma dhāraṇāya kho bhāradvāja dhammassavanam bahu kāra
translated: “The hearing of the Dhamma is very helpful for the retention of the Dhamma,

original: No cetaṁ dhammaṁ suṇeyya, nayidaṁ dhammaṁ dhāreyya.
analyzed: no ca itam dhammam suṇeyya na idam dhammam dhāreyya
translated: if one had not heard the Dhamma, one would not retain the Dhamma.

original: Yasmā ca kho dhammaṁ suṇāti tasmā dhammaṁ dhāreti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho dhammam suṇāti tasmai dhammam dhāreti
translated: But because one hears the Dhamma, one retains the Dhamma.

original: Tasmā dhammadhāraṇāya dhammassavanaṁ bahukāran”ti.
analyzed: tasmai dhamma dhāraṇāya dhammassavanam
translated: Therefore, the hearing of the Dhamma is very helpful for the retention of the Dhamma.”

original: “Dhammassavanassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: dhammassavanassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is very helpful for the hearing of the Dhamma?

original: Dhammassavanassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: dhammassavanassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: We ask Master Gotama about the thing that is very helpful for the hearing of the Dhamma.”

original: “Dhammassavanassa kho, bhāradvāja, sotāvadhānaṁ bahukāraṁ.🔽No cetaṁ sotaṁ odaheyya, nayidaṁ dhammaṁ suṇeyya.
analyzed: dhammassavanassa kho bhāradvāja sota avadhānam bahu kāra  no ca itam sotam odaheyya na yidam dhammam suṇeyya
translated: “The giving ear is very helpful for the hearing of the Dhamma,🔽if one did not give ear, one would not hear the Dhamma.

original: Yasmā ca kho sotaṁ odahati tasmā dhammaṁ suṇāti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho sotam odahati tasmai dhammam suṇāti
translated: But because one gives ear, one hears the Dhamma.

original: Tasmā dhammassavanassa sotāvadhānaṁ bahukāran”ti.
analyzed: tasmā dhammassavanassa sotāvadhānam
translated: Therefore, listening is a great help for hearing the Dhamma.”

original: “Sotāvadhānassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: sotāvadhānassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammo bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the great help for listening?”

original: Sotāvadhānassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: sotāvadhānassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: “We ask Master Gotama about the great help for listening.”

original: “Sotāvadhānassa kho, bhāradvāja, payirupāsanā bahukārā.
analyzed: sotāvadhānassa kho bhāradvāja payiḥ upāsanā bahu kārā
translated: “Honouring is the great help for listening.

original: No cetaṁ payirupāseyya, nayidaṁ sotaṁ odaheyya.
analyzed: na u ca itam payiḥ upāseyya na idam sotam odaheyya
translated: If one does not honour, one’s ears will not be attuned.

original: Yasmā ca kho payirupāsati tasmā sotaṁ odahati.
analyzed: yasmai ca khalu payiḥ upāsati tasmai sotam odahati
translated: But because one honours, one’s ears are attuned.

original: Tasmā sotāvadhānassa payirupāsanā bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmā sotāvadhānassa payirupāsanā
translated: Therefore, honouring is the great help for listening.”

original: “Payirupāsanāya pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: payirupāsanāya pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammo bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the great help for honouring?”

original: Payirupāsanāya bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: payis upāsanāya bahu kāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: “We ask Master Gotama about the great help for honouring.”

original: “Payirupāsanāya kho, bhāradvāja, upasaṅkamanaṁ bahukāraṁ.🔽No cetaṁ upasaṅkameyya, nayidaṁ payirupāseyya.
analyzed: payiḥ upāsanāya khalu bhāradvājaḥ upasaṅkamanam bahu kāra  na u ca itam upasaṅkameyya na idam payiḥ upāseyya
translated: “Approaching is the great help for honouring.🔽If one does not approach, one will not honour.

original: Yasmā ca kho upasaṅkamati tasmā payirupāsati.
analyzed: yasmai ca khalu upasaṅkamati tasmai payiḥ upāsati
translated: But because one approaches, one honours.

original: Tasmā payirupāsanāya upasaṅkamanaṁ bahukāran”ti.
analyzed: tasmai payiḥ upāsanāya upasaṅkamanam
translated: Therefore, going to attend on him is of great benefit.”

original: “Upasaṅkamanassa pana, bho gotama, katamo dhammo bahukāro?
analyzed: upasaṅkamanassa pana bho gotama katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the thing of great benefit for going to attend on him?”

original: Upasaṅkamanassa bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ pucchāmā”ti.
analyzed: upasaṅkamanassa bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam pucchāma ati
translated: “We ask Master Gotama about the thing of great benefit for going to attend on him.”

original: “Upasaṅkamanassa kho, bhāradvāja, saddhā bahukārā.🔽No cetaṁ saddhā jāyetha, nayidaṁ upasaṅkameyya.
analyzed: upasaṅkamanassa kho bhāradvāja saddhā bahu kārā  na u ca itam saddhā jāyetha na idam upasaṅkameyya
translated: “Faith is the thing of great benefit for going to attend on him.🔽If faith did not arise, one would not go to attend on him.

original: Yasmā ca kho saddhā jāyati tasmā upasaṅkamati.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho saddhā jāyati tasmai upasaṅkamati
translated: But because faith arises, one goes to attend on him.

original: Tasmā upasaṅkamanassa saddhā bahukārā”ti.
analyzed: tasmai upasaṅkamanassa saddhā bahu kārā ati
translated: Therefore, faith is the thing of great benefit for going to attend on him.”

original: “Saccānurakkhaṇaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ apucchimha, saccānurakkhaṇaṁ bhavaṁ gotamo byākāsi;
analyzed: sacca anurakkhaṇam mayam bhavantam gotamam apucchimha sacca anurakkhaṇam bhavam gotamaḥ byākāsi
translated: “We asked Master Gotama about the guarding of the truth, and Master Gotama answered about the guarding of the truth.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca tena camha attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camha atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Saccānubodhaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ apucchimha, saccānubodhaṁ bhavaṁ gotamo byākāsi;
analyzed: sacca anubodham mayam bhavantam gotamam apucchimha sacca anubodham bhavam gotamaḥ byākāsi
translated: We asked Master Gotama about the understanding of the truth, and Master Gotama answered about the understanding of the truth.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca tena camha attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camha atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Saccānuppattiṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ apucchimha, saccānuppattiṁ bhavaṁ gotamo byākāsi;
analyzed: sacca anuppattim mayam bhavantam gotamam apucchimha sacca anuppattim bhavam gotamaḥ byākāsi
translated: We asked Master Gotama about the attainment of truth, and he answered accordingly.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca tena camha attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camha atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Saccānuppattiyā bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ apucchimha, saccānuppattiyā bahukāraṁ dhammaṁ bhavaṁ gotamo byākāsi;
analyzed: sacca anuppattiyā bahukāram dhammam mayam bhavantam gotamam apucchimha sacca anuppattiyā bahukāram dhammam bhavam gotamaḥ byākāsi
translated: We asked Master Gotama about the teaching that is very helpful for attaining truth, and he answered accordingly.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca tena camha attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camha atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Yaṁyadeva ca mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ apucchimha taṁtadeva bhavaṁ gotamo byākāsi;
analyzed: yayat eva ca mayam bhavantam gotamam apucchimha tatas eva bhavam gotamaḥ
translated: Whatever we asked Master Gotama about, he has answered accordingly.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca tena camha attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camha atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Mayañhi, bho gotama, pubbe evaṁ jānāma:
analyzed: mayan hi bho gotama pubbe evam jānāma
translated: For previously, Master Gotama, we thought:

original: ‘ke ca muṇḍakā samaṇakā ibbhā kaṇhā bandhupādāpaccā, ke ca dhammassa aññātāro’ti?
analyzed: ke ca muṇḍakā samaṇakā ibbhā kaṇhā bandhu pādāpaccā ke ca dhammassa aññātāro ti
translated: ‘Who are these shaven little ascetics, these dark little bastards, these little bastards of the Sakyan, that they should know the Dhamma?’

original: Ajanesi vata me bhavaṁ gotamo samaṇesu samaṇapemaṁ, samaṇesu samaṇapasādaṁ, samaṇesu samaṇagāravaṁ.
analyzed: ajanesi vata me bhavam gotamaḥ samaṇesu samaṇa pema samaṇesu samaṇa pasāda samaṇesu samaṇa gārava
translated: The Lord has inspired in me towards the monks love, confidence and respect.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe
translated: Excellent, Lord, excellent! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: From this day forth let the Lord remember me as a lay-follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: Caṅkīsuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
